snippet: Judge Terrence C. O’Connor was a financial guardian for incapacitated clients, work he should have given up or sought approval for, the state’s Commission on Judicial Conduct found.
abstract: Judge Terrence C O'Connor of civil court in Queens, NY, is censured for doing outside work handling legal and financial affairs of incapacitated clients after he became a full-time judge; state's Commission on Judicial Conduct finds that O'Connor should have passed up work or sought approval to continue once becoming judge.
lead_paragraph: Judge Terrence C. O’Connor was a financial guardian for incapacitated clients, work he should have given up or sought approval for, the state’s Commission on Judicial Conduct found.

headline.main: Commission Censures Queens Judge for His Outside Work
headline.print_headline:
Queens Judge
Is Censured
For Work
Outside Court
